avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has accummulated localy in the mountains but blown away widely in SW faces. Ongoing SW snowfall and strong winds could have formed windslabs in N-A facing hills.

snowpackStructure.highlights: SW winds and snowfall has dominated last week but a lot of the snow was blown away. It got warm high in the mountains but it rained early on Friday so snow melted and subsided widely. It will freeze again this weekend and the snowpack will get stronger. A snowpit was taken in Bláfjöll on the 30th of January in a NW facing aspect. There was dominantly driftsnow with thin layers of hail in between. Extented column tests showed a failure at high load (ECTN26 @80cm). Snow accummulation has been very localized the last weeks and chances are of thick windslabs after constant SW winds during the weekend.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Snowfall will continue throughout Saturday in variable winds around the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have accummulated in various faces this week. Freezing temperatures could cause development or weakness in the snowpack as wet snow was buried under cold dry snow.

weatherForecast.highlights: Það lægir, styttir upp og herðir frost með Sunnudeginum. Á mánudag er búist við austlægum éljabökkum þegar lægðarbóla gengur suður fyrir land. Styttir upp og lægir á þriðjudag en frystir enn meira.

avalancheActivity.comment: 2 avalanches fell on and right by Súðavíkurhlíð early on Saturday. Avalanches also fell in Súðavíkurhlíð on the evening of 30th of Jan and night of 1st of Feb. Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25th of Jan.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has melted up to around 600m height but temperatures have dropped again this weekend. NE burst of snowfall is expected early on Sunday that could form windslabs in the mountains in various faces.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in variable wind, especially SW. Before, there was little snow in the area. A snowpit was taken on the 30th of Jan in Seljalandsdalur that showed layered windslabs with a hard thin layer between them on top of melt/freeze snow. Compression test gave straight fracture by medium stress in the new windslabs (CT13/15@56cm). Most likely it melted in the upper part of the snowpack on Friday before it froze again but deeper layers were likely not affected by the warmth. Snowfall and strong winds are expected to continue throughout Saturday but winds will turn to NE direction during the weekend.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Snowfall will continue throughout Saturday in variable winds around the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have accummulated in various faces this week. Freezing temperatures could cause development or weakness in the snowpack as wet snow was buried under cold dry snow.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA éljagangur og hvassviðri aðfaranótt Sunnudags sem varir stutt. Lægir með deginum en lítilsháttar snjókoma er möguleg á mánudag. Frystir vel og lægir á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small slabs in lower part of mountains.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are on N-E aspects after strong SW winds. Light northerly winds with some snowfall next days, stronger winds in the northern most parts by the coast.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Windslabs and cornices are present, especially on N-E aspects after SW winds lately. Few small slabs have been reported in lower part of mountains that possibly are releasing on the thaw interface from 1st of feb. No recent snowpits.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Snowfall will continue throughout Saturday in variable winds around the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have accummulated in various faces this week. Freezing temperatures could cause development or weakness in the snowpack as wet snow was buried under cold dry snow.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg norðlæg átt með smá snjókomu næstu daga. Hvassara út með annesjum. Talsvert frost.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches occurred in Norðfjörður last weekend. A small wet sluff occurred above Neskaupstaður last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs high in mountains but old stable snow in lower part of mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: High in mountains there is dry recent snow that has formed windslabs. In lower part of mountains snow has subsided and melted and is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Snowfall will continue throughout Saturday in variable winds around the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have accummulated in various faces this week. Freezing temperatures could cause development or weakness in the snowpack as wet snow was buried under cold dry snow.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt og úrkomu lítið. Vaxandi V-átt á þriðjudag. Svalt í veðri.
